alert.note: Alert for Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kennebec, northwestern Waldo and southeastern Somerset Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pittsfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fairfield, Pittsfield, Skowhegan, Clinton, Canaan, Hartland, Cornville, Burnham, Detroit, Palmyra and Troy. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 140 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
